CatDescriptText: Judy Blank, Race Street Manor, near Irwin, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think there is any racial tension in Pittsburgh? in neighborhood where you live?  If so, what do you think causes it?" answer reads: "I've only been in Pittsburgh about two weeks, and I have seen no racial tension anywhere.  In Greensburg High School, where I was a student, there was no racial tension either, and one of my best friends happened to be a Negro."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Judy Blank wearing three strand necklace, paisley dress, cardigan, and bracelet on left wrist, holding books and dark handbag, standing on Liberty Avenue with Dimlings Candy in background, Downtown
